newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Petrofina drops 3 pct in line with oils.
newsitem.headline: Petrofina drops 3 pct in line with oils.

text.p: Shares in Belgian oil and chemicals group Petrofina SA dropped almost three percent on Thursday, with analysts attributing the fall to profit-taking after recent sharp rises, weaker oil prices and a lower dollar.
"A big part of it is just profit-taking," said Banque Bruxelles Lambert (BBL) analyst Francois Poullet.
By 1420 GMT the share was down 2.63 percent at 12,025 after earlier touching a low of 11,900 francs.
"With a weak dollar and a generalised slight fall in international petroleum shares, the fall is not specific to Petrofina," one trader said.
Analysts remained positive about Petrofina's 1997 outlook.
"Petrofina is improving in the refining business and slowly improving the profitability of the division," said Poullet.
"There is good news from the exploration and production business, we can expect production to considerably increase in coming years".

But he said exploration and production would see a slight slowdown in production in 1998 because of the redevelopment at Ekofisk, a North Sea oil field where 50 to 60 percent of PetroFina's current production oil comes from.
He said that Petrofina's petrochemical division was very competitive and often superior to other such companies and expected refining to improve towards the end of this century.
"Petrofina is still a bit undervalued, so there is still some potential," Poullet added.
